thread.title: Cheaper pulses at 24 govt counters in Doon
thread.title_full: Cheaper pulses at 24 govt counters in Doon

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Cheaper pulses at 24 govt counters in Doon
text:
Tribune News Service
Dehradun, October 21
In a major initiative towards providing relief to people from the soaring prices of pulses, Chief Minister Harish Rawat has directed all District Magistrates to open at least four counters in every district where pulses will be sold at cheaper rates. A total of 24 such counters have come up in Dehradun, where arhar is being sold at Rs 145 per kg, malka Rs 90 per kg, chana Rs 70 per kg and matar dal Rs 40 per kg. Principal Secretary, Food and Civil Supplies, Radha Raturi onducted a surprise inspection at these counters today. At the Chukkumohalla counter, she was informed that a total of 30 kg of pulses had been sold. Radha Raturi also purchased 1 kg each of arhar and malka pulses for which she paid Rs 235. She interacted with customers at the GMS Road counter and enquired about the quality and prices of pulses being sold. She was informed that a total of 50 kg of pulses were sold at the counter. Similarly, at the Mothrowala counter, a total of 90 kg of pulses were sold. Radha Raturi directed the counter operators to ensure that the quality of pulses is maintained at all costs. Dehradun district supply officeer PS Pangtey also accompanied her during the inspection.
